member.name: F:vdat.Program.readBuffer
member.summary: This variable is used to read into it for the ReadWriteData()

member.name: F:vdat.Program.progressCounter
member.summary: Used as counter for the Progress bar to know that a full buffer would be written

member.name: F:vdat.Program.IsCustomProgressCounter
member.summary: Used to know if a custom progress byte counter shall be used as temporary input

member.name: F:vdat.Program.customProgressCounter
member.summary: Used to get the custom progressed byte count

member.name: F:vdat.Program.IsProcessRunning
member.summary: Used to know if all operations are done and no new bytes will be counted so we can tell the progress bar to count patterns and such if the counted value do not match the file size to work and generelly to activate custom counting in the reader/writer routine.

member.name: F:vdat.Program.IsCustomFileCounting
member.summary: Used to know if a custom progress byte counter shall be used as temporary input

member.name: F:vdat.Program.progressFileCounter
member.summary: Used for the progress bar to know that a file would be processed

member.name: M:vdat.Program.CompareBytes(System.Byte[],System.Byte[])
member.summary: Compare Byte by Byte or Array by Array
member.returns: True if both Byte Array's do match

member.name: M:vdat.Program.ByteToString(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Convert a Byte Array to a Hex String (or a Array of), can be aligned to a specific digi.
member.param: The Byte Array to Convert to a Hex String
Do we want to aling the Hex String to a specific Length?

member.name: M:vdat.Program.CheckInput(System.String[])
member.returns: True if the Input is valid else False

member.name: M:vdat.Program.GetKeys(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Get Keys and load into buffer
member.param: The Type of the Key like eg. 'index'
The version of the Key eg. '100' for eg. index keys above or euqal to FW Version 1.00 or '180' for eg. index keys above or euqal to FW Version 1.80
member.returns: True if the Keys are found and CheckKeys() Cast return also True. Else False

member.name: M:vdat.Program.CheckKeys(System.String)
member.returns: True if the Hash of your Keys do match the knowen Hash. Else False

member.name: M:vdat.Program.ReadWriteData(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary: Kombinated Command for Read or Write Binary or Integer Data
member.param: The File that will be used to Read from or to Write to it
This is used for the "both" methode. fileToUse will be the file to read from and fileToUse2 will be the file to write to it.
Defination for Read "r" or Write "w" or if you have big data just use Both "b"
Defination for Binary Data (bin) or Integer Data (int) when write to a file
byte array of the binary data to read or write
integer array of the integer data to read or write
Otional, used for the "both" methode to deffine a offset to start to read from a file. If you do not wan't to read from the begin use this var to tell the Routine to jump to your deffined offset.
Optional, also used for the "both" methode to deffine to only to read a specific byte count and not till the end of the file.
